## Vector.set() method

Returns a new vector equal to the old one, except with the entry at `index` replaced with `value`

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
set(index: number, value: S): Vector<S>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  index | <code>number</code> | The index of the value to replace |
|  value | <code>S</code> | The new value |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Vector<S>`

The new vector
